page.title: 07 CHURCHES AND SCHOOLS
page.content: The Anglican and Methodist Churches shared the same building at first. Now it is only an Anglican Church and the Methodist part seems to have gone. There is a Catholic Church and Horeb Baptist Church which is a very small building. The attendance at the churches seems to be good. There are five Primary Schools and of which one is Roman Catholic and one Comprehensive School. As the birth rate is still falling some of these schools may have to close. At one time children from the surrounding area were not allowed by their parents to go to Hattersley because there were slum clearance houses and they felt their children should not mix with the families there. At present more children are attending the Comprehensive Schools and the stigma is not so great.
